metadata.title: CVE-2015-5237 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
protobuf allows remote authenticated attackers to cause a heap-based bufferoverflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5237` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

elpa-protobuf-mode - 3.12.4-1ubuntu5
libprotobuf-java - 3.12.4-1ubuntu5
libprotobuf-lite23 - 3.12.4-1ubuntu5
libprotobuf23 - 3.12.4-1ubuntu5
libprotoc23 - 3.12.4-1ubuntu5
protobuf-compiler - 3.12.4-1ubuntu5
python3-protobuf - 3.12.4-1ubuntu5
ruby-google-protobuf - 3.12.4-1ubuntu5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: protobuf package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.12.4-1ubuntu5').
